ratings.comment: Loved the professor, but if you don't have a good TA you are screwed for tests
She's  a great professor and genuinely would like to see all of her students pass. Her focus is to teach you not trick you by tests and exams.

Dr. Larson cares so much about her students. She adds in her own spunk to her lectures, making them funny and enjoyable. She posts all the lecture slides online as well as practice quizzes for the weekly quizzes . Tests are usually straight from lecture or lab. She made me like a subject I thought I hated. Great professor.

Dr. Larson is an excellent professor who takes the time to make the information she presents as clear as possible for the students. If you go to lecture, take good notes, and work for your grade you will earn the grade you want. Dr. Larson runs this class very efficiently and helps the TA's and the students to all work together. Wonderful person!

She is an amazing professor! Take this class if you can instead of 103/104. The class is taught in a conceptual matter and Larson makes a point to relate the material to real life issues. She does demos that are interesting and help to improve understanding of the material. Amazing class in general!

if you need to take a chemistry credit, not necessarily 103/104, I would definitely tai this class! very easy chemistry course! however, if you're looking for something math-based, this is not the class. it is content based, but she is very straight forward. her tests are very fair GO TO LECTURE and study and you'll be fine. print out slides.

I still didn't do great in this class, because chemistry is honestly my worst subject. However, Dr. Larson was incredible. She was so fun-loving and she was always open for questions through email or office hours.
Dr. Larson is an amazing professor. She made me like and LEARN chemistry, which is AMAZING!
Best professor I have ever had! Very manageable class. Hope to get a good TA cause some absolutely suck, but the professor is fabulous. Go to her with any questions or concerns. She loves it.

Professor Larson is the best chemistry professor I could hope for! She cares about students actually understanding what she teaches, the TAs are on top of things, and the class itself isn't that difficult.

Making sure students are learning is a high priority for Larson and it shows!  I already failed Chem 103, so in 108 there is a team of highly involved TAs and a professor that really cares. I was a few points away from an A!  I loved Chem 108 because of Larson and the content is applicable to real life!

She is an amazing teacher. Gk to lectures and write down everything she says. If you need help go to office hours she is always there to help! The tests are a bit tricky and sometimes she picks out small details but doable. There are weekly quizzes.
She makes everything clear even for those who know little about chemistry. The grades are fair and it requires you to do well during the semester instead of just the exams.

she was one of the best teachers i've ever had.  Definitely need to go to class because there are a lot of details that she goes over on her power points. Write down pretty much everything she says unless she says it won't be on your test. But she was extremely clear and so helpful.  Best teacher ever.
Overall great class! She is so concerned with students which makes the class so good. Take good lecture notes and study for quizzes/tests and you will be fine!

Prof. Larson makes learning about chemistry fun and interesting, but she often jumps around in her lectures and makes it extremely hard to write notes.  The quizzes are quite detail oriented while the tests are less detailed and the final is concept based.  If you get a good TA you should be fine.

Wonderful professor! Always cheerful and so dedicated- she makes chemistry interesting! She is always willing to help, and is so easy to talk to. Very fair grader. Make sure you attend lecture, as exams are based heavily off of them. Used text very little aside from review/reference. Highly recommended!

Dr. Larson is great. She makes sure you understand the information and has a student board to address problems in the section. She has 4 exams for 108 and then a cumulative final. She also gives two weekly quizzes (one for the lab and one for lecture material) and 5 written assignments. Not hard if you study a lot for the exams!

Dr. Larson is extremely upbeat and willing to answer ANY questions that you might have. The course content is really based off of her lecture slides, but she presents the information in a very clear way. I highly reccommend joining her student board. Chemistry is not my strong point but I definitely thought the class was fair and learned alot!

Dr. Larson is definitely one of my favorite teachers this semester. She is a great teacher and it is obvious she loves what she is doing.  She loves having students come to her office hours and is ready and willing to answer questions. Pay attention to lecture and remember even the smallest details because you never know what will be on it.

Professor Larson is an upbeat happy go lucky teacher. You will enjoy her presence and she is very charismatic. Only thing is she does not specify well what needs to be remembered (ie. graphs that she would like memorized) Also , highly recommend attending her council. She listens very well to the needs of her students!

Dr. Larson is extremely enthusiastic. It is a pleasure to have a professor that actually likes to teach !She is also a role model to all of us young women. She teaches chemistry in a male dominated feild and not only is she a PhD, but also a professional waterskier. She came to class just 24hrs after having shoulder surgery !
Wonderful teacher! She really loves what she does and is good at explaining/clarifying material. Posts lecture slides online and tests/quizzes are straightforward.
She is a great teacher! Super fun and always smiling, you can really tell she loves what she does and wants you to do well!
good
